slurm.files¶

Module Contents¶

Functions¶

run(cmd)

Runs a command string and returns the output

mkdir(path)

Makes a directory

rmdir(path)

Removes (deletes) a directory

rm(fname)

Removes (deletes) a file or list of files

find(path, fname)

Given a path, this will recursively search for a file (bob.txt) or

touch(file)

Given a file name, operates like the Unix touch command

file_size(s)

Given a file size in bytes, this returns a printable size
slurm.files.run(cmd)[source]¶

Runs a command string and returns the output

slurm.files.mkdir(path)[source]¶

Makes a directory

slurm.files.rmdir(path)[source]¶

Removes (deletes) a directory

slurm.files.rm(fname)[source]¶

Removes (deletes) a file or list of files

slurm.files.find(path, fname)[source]¶

Given a path, this will recursively search for a file (bob.txt) or pattern (*.txt). It returns an array of found file paths.

slurm.files.touch(file)[source]¶

Given a file name, operates like the Unix touch command

slurm.files.file_size(s)[source]¶

Given a file size in bytes, this returns a printable size

Returns: (size, prefix) - > (12.345, ‘GB’)
